exact.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Police are still investigating the exact cause of the accident.
The timing had to be exact.
The exact location of the hostages is unknown.
I know her birthday’s in July, but I can’t remember the exact date.
It’s not an exact copy, but most people wouldn’t notice the difference.
Some concepts in Chinese medicine have no exact equivalent in Western medicine.
exact.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: someone who is exact is very careful and thorough in what they do
exact.translation[0].note_box[0].section: the exact amount/number/figure
I don’t know the exact amount, but it was a lot.
the exact size
First, cut a piece of wood about 1cm x 10cm – the exact size doesn’t matter.
the exact date
He plans to retire soon, but the exact date is not fixed.
the exact time/moment
At that exact moment, the phone rang.
the exact position/location/spot etc
The satellite pictures showed the enemy’s exact location.
an exact copy/replica
The vessel is an exact replica of a Viking longboat.
an exact equivalent
There is no exact equivalent in English for the phrase.
an exact match
The two DNA samples were an exact match.
the exact details
Nobody knows the exact details of what happened.
somebody’s exact words
Try to remember his exact words – it’s very important.
the exact wording
What was the exact wording of the message?
the exact same thing/way etc
If you’d been there, you’d have done the exact same thing.
exact.translation[0].note_box[1].section: an exact  number, amount, or time is completely correct and is no more and no less than it should be
The exact weight of the baby at birth was 3.2 kg.
precise  information is based on clear and exact figures or measurements, especially when it is important that no mistakes are made
We need to know your precise location.
It’s difficult to be precise about the number of deaths caused by smoking.
completely correct because all the details are true
The witness tried to give an accurate description of what she had seen.
exact.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to demand and get something from someone by using threats, force etc
exact.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: I exacted a promise from Ros that she wouldn’t say a word.
exact.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to demand and get something from someone, especially using forceful methods
exact.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: My client is only claiming the return of taxes exacted under an unlawful demand.
